  • EPP_TRANSFER_INFO_RESPONSE_AUTHINFO_NOT_RESET (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_INFO_RESPONSE_MISSING_OR_INVALID_RGP_STATUS (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_INFO_RESPONSE_MISSING_OR_INVALID_STATUS_CODE (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_INFO_RESPONSE_UNEXPECTED_EXPIRY_DATE (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_LOSING_REGISTRAR_NO_MESSAGE_RECEIVED (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_SERVER_ACCEPTS_INCORRECT_AUTHINFO (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_SERVER_ACCEPTS_INSECURE_AUTHINFO (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_SERVER_ACCEPTS_INVALID_PERIOD (ERROR)
  • EPP_TRANSFER_SERVER_PROCESSED_REJECTED_TRANSFER (ERROR)
  • EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_FAILURE (ERROR)
  • EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_SUCCESS (ERROR)
  • EPP_XML_PARSE_ERROR (ERROR)

4.4.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid01 (string)
  2. epp.clid02 (string)
  3. epp.hostModel (string)
  4. epp.hostName (string)
  5. epp.pwd01 (string)
  6. epp.pwd02 (string)
  7. epp.registeredContacts (array)
  8. epp.registeredNames (array)
  9. epp.registeredNameservers (array)
  10. epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
  11. epp.secDNSInterfaces (string)
  12. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate01 (string)
  13. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate02 (string)
  14. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

4.4.7. Sequence diagram

4.5. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

4.5.1. Description

The RDE test suite validates Registry Data Escrow deposits generated for the TLD or RSP. These deposits MUST comply with the specifications in the Registry Agreement and with RFC 8909 and RFC 9022.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.5.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. rde-01 - validate deposit filename format
  2. rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file
  3. rde-03 - decrypt deposit file(s)
  4. rde-04 - validate XML/CSV
  5. rde-05 - validate object types
  6. rde-06 - validate object counts
  7. rde-07 - validate domain objects
  8. rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)
  9. rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)
  10. rde-10 - validate registrar objects
  11. rde-11 - validate IDN table objects (if applicable)
  12. rde-12 - validate NNDN objects
  13. rde-13 - validate EPP parameters object
  14. rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)

4.5.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.5.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • rde.encryptionKey

4.5.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_INVALID_CC (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_INVALID_EMAIL (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_INVALID_ROID (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_MULTIPLE_POSTALINFO_TYPES (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_NON_UNIQUE_ID (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_UNKNOWN_ACRR (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_UNKNOWN_CLID (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_UNKNOWN_CRRR (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_UNKNOWN_RERR (ERROR)
  • RDE_CONTACT_HAS_UNKNOWN_UPRR (ERROR)
  • RDE_DECRYPTION_FAILED (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_CLID (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_CRDATE (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_EXDATE (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_REGISTRANT (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_ROID (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_INVALID_STATUS (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_CLID (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_CRDATE (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_EXDATE (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_REGISTRANT (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_ROID (ERROR)
  • RDE_DOMAIN_HAS_MISSING_STATUS (ERROR)
  • RDE_GREETING_DOES_NOT_MATCH (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_INVALID_CLID (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_INVALID_IP_ADDRESS (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_INVALID_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_INVALID_ROID (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_INVALID_STATUS (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_MISSING_CLID (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_MISSING_IP_ADDRESS (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_MISSING_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_MISSING_ROID (ERROR)
  • RDE_HOST_HAS_MISSING_STATUS (ERROR)
  • RDE_IDN_OBJECT_INVALID (ERROR)
  • RDE_IDN_OBJECT_MISSING (ERROR)
  • RDE_IDN_OBJECT_UNEXPECTED (ERROR)
  • RDE_INVALID_CSV (ERROR)
  • RDE_INVALID_FILENAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_INVALID_SIGNATURE (ERROR)
  • RDE_INVALID_XML (ERROR)
  • RDE_MISSING_OBJECT_URI (ERROR)
  • RDE_MIXED_TYPES (ERROR)
  • RDE_NNDN_CONFLICTS_WITH_DOMAIN (ERROR)
  • RDE_OBJECT_COUNT_MISMATCH (ERROR)
  • RDE_POLICY_OBJECT_INVALID (ERROR)
  • RDE_POLICY_OBJECT_MISSING (ERROR)
  • RDE_POLICY_OBJECT_MISSING_OBJECTS (ERROR)
  • RDE_POLICY_OBJECT_UNEXPECTED_OBJECTS (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_INVALID_GURID (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_INVALID_ID (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_INVALID_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_MISSING_GURID (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_MISSING_ID (ERROR)
  • RDE_REGISTRAR_HAS_MISSING_NAME (ERROR)
  • RDE_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • RDE_UNEXPECTED_OBJECT_URI (ERROR)
  • RDE_XML_PARSE_ERROR (ERROR)

4.5.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.greeting (string)
  2. rde.depositFile (file)
  3. rde.publicKey (file)
  4. rde.signatureFile (file)

4.5.7. Sequence diagram

4.6. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

4.6.1. Description

The RDE test suite validates the IDN table(s) for a TLD or RSP, including compliance with specifications for variant labels at the top- or second- level, and conformance with the IDN Guidelines.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.6.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. idn-01 - Label validation test
  2. idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  3. idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  4. idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test

4.6.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. Standard IDN Test
  4. IDN Test (RSP Evaluation)

4.6.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCSR
  • epp.clientCertificate

4.6.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • IDN_SERVER_ACCEPTS_INVALID_LABEL (ERROR)
  • IDN_SERVER_REJECTS_VALID_LABEL (ERROR)
  • IDN_VARIANT_LABEL_NOT_BLOCKED (ERROR)
  • IDN_VARIANT_SERVER_ACCEPTS_VARIANT_CREATE_FROM_INCORRECT_REGISTRAR (ERROR)
  • IDN_VARIANT_SERVER_ACCEPTS_VARIANT_CREATE_WITH_INCORRECT_REGISTRANT (ERROR)

4.6.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid01 (string)
  2. epp.clid02 (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd01 (string)
  5. epp.pwd02 (string)
  6. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate01 (string)
  7. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate02 (string)

4.6.7. Sequence diagram

4.7. SRS Gateway

4.7.1. Description

The SRS Gateway test suite validates the conformance of the Gateway registry infrastructure of a TLD or RSP, and the synchronisation between primary and gateway systems.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.7.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. srsgw-01 - IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity
  2. srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  3. srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  4. srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  5. srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
  6. srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
  7. srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
  8. srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
  9. srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  10. srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  11. srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  12. srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  13. srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization
  14. srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization
  15. srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization

4.7.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. SRS Gateway Test
  2. SRS Gateway RSP Evaluation Test

4.7.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCSR
  • epp.clientCertificate

4.7.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • EPP_DNS_RESOLUTION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_OBJECT_SHOULD_EXIST (ERROR)
  • EPP_OBJECT_SHOULD_NOT_EXIST (ERROR)
  • EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SERVICE_PORT_UNREACHABLE (ERROR)
  • EPP_TLS_CONNECTION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_FAILURE (ERROR)
  • EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_SUCCESS (ERROR)
  • EPP_XML_PARSE_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_CONTACT_CREATE_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_CONTACT_CREATE_OBJECT_HAS_MISSING_OR_INVALID_PROPERTIES (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_CONTACT_CREATE_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_CREATE_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_CREATE_OBJECT_HAS_MISSING_OR_INVALID_PROPERTIES (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_CREATE_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_DELETE_DOMAIN_NOT_PENDINGDELETE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_DELETE_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_DELETE_RGP_STATUS_NOT_PENDINGDELETERESTORABLE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_RENEW_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_RENEW_OBJECT_HAS_INVALID_EXDATE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_RENEW_OBJECT_NOT_UPDATED_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_APPROVAL_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_APPROVAL_OBJECT_HAS_INCORRECT_CLID (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_APPROVAL_OBJECT_NOT_UPDATED_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_APPROVAL_OBJECT_STILL_PENDING_TRANSFER (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_REQUEST_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_REQUEST_OBJECT_HAS_INCORRECT_CLID (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_REQUEST_OBJECT_NOT_PENDING_TRANSFER (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_DOMAIN_TRANSFER_REQUEST_OBJECT_NOT_UPDATED_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_DNS_RESOLUTION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_OBJECT_SHOULD_EXIST (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_OBJECT_SHOULD_NOT_EXIST (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_SERVICE_PORT_UNREACHABLE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_TLS_CONNECTION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_FAILURE (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_UNEXPECTED_COMMAND_SUCCESS (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_EPP_XML_PARSE_ERROR (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_HOST_CREATE_FAILED (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_HOST_CREATE_OBJECT_HAS_MISSING_OR_INVALID_PROPERTIES (ERROR)
  • SRSGW_HOST_CREATE_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_WITHIN_DEADLINE (ERROR)

4.7.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid01 (string)
  2. epp.clid02 (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd01 (string)
  5. epp.pwd02 (string)
  6. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate01 (string)
  7. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate02 (string)
  8. rdap.baseURLs (object)
  9. srsgw.eppClid01 (string)
  10. srsgw.eppClid02 (string)
  11. srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  12. srsgw.eppPwd01 (string)
  13. srsgw.eppPwd02 (string)
  14. srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)
  15. srsgw.serverIssuedClientCertificate01 (string)
  16. srsgw.serverIssuedClientCertificate02 (string)

4.7.7. Sequence diagram

4.8. DNSSEC Operations

4.8.1. Description

This test suite verifies the ability of an RSP to carry out standard DNSSEC operational procedures while maintaining a chain of trust to the parent zone.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.8.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover
  2. dnssecOps02-KSKRollover - KSK rollover
  3. dnssecOps03-AlgorithmRollover - algorithm rollover

4.8.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test

4.8.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • dnssecOps.xfrACL

4.8.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_OPS_ALGORITHM_ROLLOVER_CHAIN_OF_TRUST_BROKEN (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_ALGORITHM_ROLLOVER_NOT_COMPLETED (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_INVALID_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_KSK_ROLLOVER_CHAIN_OF_TRUST_BROKEN (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_KSK_ROLLOVER_NOT_COMPLETED (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_XFR_FAILED (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_ZSK_ROLLOVER_CHAIN_OF_TRUST_BROKEN (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_OPS_ZSK_ROLLOVER_NOT_COMPLETED (ERROR)

4.8.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone (string)
  2. dnssecOps.csk (boolean)
  3. dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone (string)
  4. dnssecOps.nameservers (object)
  5. dnssecOps.primaryServer (string)
  6. dnssecOps.tsigKey (object)
  7. dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone (string)

4.8.7. Sequence diagram

4.9. Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

4.9.1. Description

This test suite verifies an RSP’s support for the minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs), and the Launch Extension (RFC 8334).

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.9.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. minimumRPMs-01 - Claims <check> command test
  2. minimumRPMs-02 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  3. minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test

4.9.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.9.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.9.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • RPMS_MISSING_CLAIMS_KEY (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_INFO_OBJECT_DOES_NOT_EXIST (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_INFO_OBJECT_IS_HAS_MISSING_OR_INVALID_PROPERTIES (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_FAILURE_USING_VALID_SMD (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_SUCCESS_USING_INVALID_SMD (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_SUCCESS_USING_REVOKED_SMD (ERROR)
  • RPMS_SUNRISE_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_SUCCESS_USING_SMD_WITH_REVOKED_SIGNATURE (ERROR)
  • RPMS_TRADEMARK_CREATE_INFO_OBJECT_DOES_NOT_EXIST (ERROR)
  • RPMS_TRADEMARK_CREATE_INFO_OBJECT_IS_HAS_MISSING_OR_INVALID_PROPERTIES (ERROR)
  • RPMS_TRADEMARK_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_FAILURE_USING_VALID_CLAIM_KEY (ERROR)
  • RPMS_TRADEMARK_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_SUCCESS_USING_INVALID_ACCEPTANCE_DATE (ERROR)
  • RPMS_TRADEMARK_CREATE_UNEXPECTED_SUCCESS_USING_INVALID_CLAIM_KEY (ERROR)
  • RPMS_UNEXPECTED_CLAIMS_KEY (ERROR)

4.9.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid01 (string)
  2. epp.clid02 (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd01 (string)
  5. epp.pwd02 (string)
  6. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate01 (string)
  7. epp.serverIssuedClientCertificate02 (string)
  8. minimumRPMS.claimsTLD (string)
  9. minimumRPMS.sunriseModels (string)
  10. minimumRPMS.sunriseTLD (string)

4.9.7. Sequence diagram

4.10. Standard Integration Test

4.10.1. Description

This test suite verifies that the critical registry services of the TLD are properly integrated and functioning within the requirements of the Service Level Agreement.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.10.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. integration-01 - EPP -> RDAP Integration Test
  2. integration-02 - EPP -> DNS Integration Test
  3. integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

4.10.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test

4.10.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • integration.rdeSFTPACL
  • integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey

4.10.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • INTEGRATION_DNS_ANSWER_IS_INCORRECT (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_DNS_QUERY_FAILED (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_DOMAIN_NOT_PRESENT_IN_DNS (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_DOMAIN_NOT_PRESENT_IN_RDAP (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_RDAP_REQUEST_FAILED (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_RDE_DEADLINE_MISSED (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_RDE_MISSING_OBJECTS (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_RDE_SFTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • INTEGRATION_RDE_SFTP_SERVER_UNREACHABLE (ERROR)

4.10.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. dns.nameservers (object)
  2. epp.hostModel (string)
  3. integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)
  4. integration.rdeSFTPHostname (string)
  5. integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
  6. integration.rriACL (array)
  7. rdap.baseURLs (object)

4.10.7. Sequence diagram

5. Resources

5.1. dnssecOps.xfrACL

5.1.1. Description

A list of IPv4 and IPv6 address(es) from which zone file transfers to primary DNS servers will be made. The list is a plain text file with each IP address on a separate line.

5.1.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/dnssecOps.xfrACL.txt

5.2. epp.clientACL

5.2.1. Description

A list of IPv4 and IPv6 address(es) from which client connections to the operator’s EPP server will be made. The list is a plain text file with each IP address on a separate line.

5.2.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.clientACL.txt

5.3. epp.clientCSR

5.3.1. Description

For servers that operate a private CA, this CSR may be used to issue a client certificate. This certificate must then be provided in the epp.clientCertificate input parameter.

5.3.2. URL

5.4. epp.clientCertificate

5.4.1. Description

RFC 5734 requires servers to perform authentication of clients by means of a client certificate. Operators MUST configure their systems to permit the test client to connect using the certificate found at this URL.

5.4.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.clientCertificate.pem

5.5. epp.tlsCertificateStore

5.5.1. Description

A PEM-formatted file containing the CA certificates trusted by Mozilla. For more information, see https://curl.se/docs/caextract.html.

EPP servers MUST use a certificate that has a chain of trust to one of the CAs present in this file.

5.5.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.tlsCertificateStore.pem

5.6. integration.rdeSFTPACL

5.6.1. Description

A list of IPv4 and IPv6 address(es) from which client connections to the operator’s SFTP server will be made. The list is a plain text file with each IP address on a separate line.

5.6.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/integration.rdeSFTPACL.txt

5.7. integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey

5.7.1. Description

The SSH public key that will be used to authenticate connections to the operator’s SFTP server.

5.7.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey.pem

5.8. rde.encryptionKey

5.8.1. Description

RDE deposit files MUST be encrypted using OpenPGP (RFC 4880). The PGP key that MUST be used to encrypt the escrow deposit file may be found at this URL.

5.8.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/rde.encryptionKey.asc

6. Test Cases

6.1. dns-address01 - Name server address must be globally routable

6.1.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.1.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address01.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

In order for the domain and its resources to be accessible, authoritative name servers must have addresses in the routable public addressing space.

IANA is responsible for global coordination of the IP addressing system. Aside its address allocation activities, it maintains reserved address ranges for special uses. These ranges can be categorized into three types : Special purpose IPv4 addresses, Special purpose IPv6 addresses and Multicast reserved addresses.

6.1.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_ADDRESS01_FAILED (ERROR)

6.1.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.1.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.1.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.1.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.1.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.2. dns-address02 - Reverse DNS entry exists for name server IP address

6.2.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.2.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address02.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Some anti-spam techniques use reverse DNS lookup to allow incoming traffic. In order to prevent name servers to be blocked or blacklisted, DNS administrators should publish PTR records associated to name server addresses.

[technical reference to be found]

6.2.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_ADDRESS02_FAILED (ERROR)

6.2.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.2.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.2.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.2.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.2.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.3. dns-address03 - Reverse DNS entry matches name server name

6.3.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.3.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address03.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Some anti-spam techniques use reverse DNS lookup to allow incoming traffic. In order to prevent name servers to be blocked or blacklisted, DNS administrators should publish PTR records associated with the name server addresses.

Moreover, as mentioned in paragraph 2.1 of RFC 1912 when a PTR record exists, it must match the host name.

6.3.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_ADDRESS03_FAILED (ERROR)

6.3.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.3.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.3.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.3.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.3.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.4. dns-connectivity01 - UDP connectivity to name servers

6.4.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.4.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity01.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

UDP is the fundamental protocol to reach a general purpose name server hosting a zone, “DNS servers MUST be able to service UDP […]” (RFC 1123, section 6.1.3.2, page 75), also restated in RFC 7766, section 5.

This Test Case will verify if the name servers of Child Zone are reachable over UDP. The name servers tested are both those in the delegation of Child Zone and those in the NS records in the Child Zone itself.

Most Zonemaster Test Cases will query the name servers in the delegation or the name servers appointed by the NS records in the zone for the NS or SOA record, or both. It is crucial that problems are reported, but instead of letting several Test Cases report the same problems found, most Test Cases assume that this test case is run. Only this Test Case will report problems found in the following areas over UDP:

  • Name Server not responding to a query without EDNS.
  • Name Server not including SOA record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on a SOA query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server not including NS record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on an NS query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server not setting the AA flag in a response with SOA or NS in answer section.
  • Name Server responding with unexpected RCODE Name (any except “NoError”) on query for SOA or NS for Child Zone.

In addition, this test case will output a message if transport over IPv4 or IPv6 has been disabled.

6.4.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)

6.4.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.4.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.4.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.4.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.4.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.5. dns-connectivity02 - TCP connectivity to name servers

6.5.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.5.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity02.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

TCP is a protocol to reach a general purpose name server hosting a zone, “All general-purpose DNS implementations MUST support […] TCP transport” (RFC 7766, section 5).

This Test Case will verify if the name servers of Child Zone are reachable over TCP. The name servers tested are both those in the delegation of Child Zone and those in the NS records in the Child Zone itself.

This Test Case will mimic the tests done by Connectivity01, but over TCP instead:

  • Name Server responding to a query.
  • Name Server including SOA record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on a SOA query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server including NS record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on an NS query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server setting the AA flag in a response with SOA or NS in answer section.
  • Name Server responding with expected RCODE Name (“NoError”) on query for SOA or NS for Child Zone.

6.5.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)

6.5.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.5.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.5.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.5.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.5.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.6. dns-connectivity03 - AS Diversity

6.6.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.6.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity03.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The objective in this test is to verify that all IP addresses of the domain’s authoritative name servers are announced from different ASNs (autonomous system number). See RFC 1930 and Wikipedia for an explanation of AS (autonomous system).

This test is done separately on IPv4 and IPv6, and both must match the criterion.

RFC 2182, section 3.1, clearly specifies that distinct authoritative name servers for a child domain should be placed in different topological and geographical locations. The objective is to minimise the likelihood of a single failure disabling all of them.

6.6.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_EMPTY_ASN_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_ERROR_ASN_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV4_ONE_ASN (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV6_ONE_ASN (ERROR)

6.6.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.6.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.6.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.6.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.6.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.7. dns-consistency02 - SOA RNAME consistency

6.7.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.7.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency02.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same SOA record for the tested domain (section 4.2.1 of RFC 1034). As per section 3.3.13 of RFC 1035, the RNAME field in the SOA RDATA refers to the administrative contact. An inconsistency in the administrative contact for the domain might result in operational failures being reported to different persons.

The objective of this test is to verify that the administrative contact is consistent between different authoritative name servers.

6.7.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_RNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)

6.7.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.7.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.7.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.7.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.7.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.8. dns-consistency03 - SOA timers consistency

6.8.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.8.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency03.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

All SOA record timer fields must be consistent across all authoritative name servers. An inconsistency in these fields might result in operational inconsistencies for the designated zone.

There are other test cases that provide consistency tests for the other SOA fields:

  • CONSISTENCY02 (RNAME)
  • CONSISTENCY06 (MNAME)

6.8.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)

6.8.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.8.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.8.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.8.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.8.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.9. dns-consistency04 - Name server NS consistency

6.9.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.9.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency04.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same NS record set for the tested domain, child zone (RFC 1034, section 4.2.2). Any inconsistencies in NS records described in RFC 1035, section 3.3.11, might result in operational failures.

The objective of this test is to verify that the NS records are consistent between all authoritative name servers of the child zone.

Two NS RR sets are considered to be equal if both sets have the same number of NS records, and for each NS record in one of the sets there is exactly one NS record with identical owner name, class, TTL and RDATA in the other NS set.

6.9.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_NS_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY (ERROR)

6.9.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.9.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.9.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.9.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.9.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.10. dns-consistency05 - Consistency between glue and authoritative data

6.10.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.10.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency05.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

For name servers that have IP addresses listed as glue, the IP addresses must match the authoritative A and AAAA records for that host. This is an IANA name server requirement.

The objective of this test is to verify that the glue records in the delegation are consistent with authoritative data.

6.10.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_EXTRA_ADDRESS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_IN_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_OUT_OF_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)

6.10.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.10.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.10.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.10.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.10.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.11. dns-consistency06 - SOA MNAME consistency

6.11.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.11.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency06.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same SOA record (section 4.2.1) of RFC 1034 for the tested domain. As per section 3.3.13 of RFC 1035 the MNAME field in the SOA RDATA refers to the name of “the name server that was the original or primary source of data for this zone”. Inconsistency in MNAME of the domain might result in operational failures for applications that uses MNAME.

6.11.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_MNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)

6.11.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.11.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.11.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.11.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.11.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.12. dns-delegation01 - Minimum number of name servers

6.12.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.12.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation01.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Section 4.1 of RFC 1034 specifies that there must be a minimum of two name servers for a domain. This test is done to verify this condition.

The RFC (RFC 1034) predates IPv6. Since IPv4 and IPv6 work as separate networks, this test case has been extended to test for two name servers that resolve into IPv4 addresses and IPv6 addresses respectively.

Both RFC 3901 (section 3) and RFC 4472 (section 1.3) states that a domain (zone) should be available over IPv4 for the time being. Therefore, it is by the default level in this test case considered to be more problematic not being available over IPv4 than not being available over IPv6.

6.12.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)

6.12.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.12.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.12.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.12.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.12.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.13. dns-delegation02 - Name servers must have distinct IP addresses

6.13.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.13.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation02.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

If the domain’s name servers use several different names, they can all be using the same IP address. This may be due to a configuration error, or a workaround for a certain policy restriction. This test case checks that the name servers used do not reuse the same IP addresses.

Section 4.1 of RFC 1034 says at least two name servers must be used for a delegation.

6.13.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_DEL_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)

6.13.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.13.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.13.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.13.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.13.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.14. dns-delegation03 - No truncation of referrals

6.14.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.14.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation03.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The Domain Name System defaults to using UDP for queries and answers with a DNS payload limit of 512 octets (bytes). Larger replies cause an initial truncation indication leading to a subsequent handling via TCP with substantially higher overhead. EDNS0 is used to allow for larger UDP responses thus reducing the need for use of TCP.

But IANA still maintains that referrals from the parent zone name servers must fit into a non-EDNS0 UDP DNS packet.

6.14.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_TOO_LARGE (ERROR)

6.14.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.14.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.14.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.14.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.14.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.15. dns-delegation04 - Name server is authoritative

6.15.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.15.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation04.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Subsection 6.1 of RFC 2181 specifies that the nameservers must answer authoritatively for the domain. Answers to queries to the name servers for the designated zone must have the “AA” bit set.

6.15.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_DELEGATION04_FAILED (ERROR)

6.15.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.15.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.15.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.15.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.15.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.16. dns-delegation05 - Name server must not point at CNAME alias

6.16.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.16.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation05.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Name servers for a zone are defined in NS records. An NS record points at a name, i.e. the RDATA for an NS record is a domain name. That name is the name of the name server. RFC 2181, section 10.3, states that the name of the name server must not itself point at a CNAME.

The objective of this test is to verify that name servers of the tested domain (zone) do not point at CNAME records.

6.16.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_IS_CNAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)

6.16.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.16.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.16.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.16.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.16.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.17. dns-delegation07 - Parent glue name records present in child

6.17.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.17.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation07.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

If the list of name servers for a domain obtained from its parent are not found in its its child zone, then it leads to an inconsistency (section 2.3 of RIPE-114)

6.17.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_DELEGATION07_FAILED (ERROR)

6.17.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.17.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.17.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.17.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.17.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.18. dns-nameserver01 - A name server should not be a recursor

6.18.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.18.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver01.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

To ensure consistency in DNS, an authoritative name server should not be configured to do recursive lookups. Also, open recursive resolvers are considered bad internet practice due to their capability of assisting in large scale DDoS attacks. The introduction to RFC 5358 elaborates on mixing recursor and authoritative functionality, and the issue is further elaborated by D.J. Bernstein.

Section 2.5 of RFC 2870 have very specific requirement on disabling recursion functionality on root name servers.

6.18.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_IS_A_RECURSOR (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)

6.18.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.18.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.18.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.18.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.18.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.19. dns-nameserver02 - Test of EDNS0 support

6.19.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.19.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver02.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

EDNS(0) is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a DNS implementation, and is now basically required by any new functionality in DNS such as DNSSEC. EDNS(0) is standardized in RFC 6891.

This test case checks that all name servers has the capability to do EDNS(0) or if not, correctly replies to queries containing EDNS (OPT record).

Servers not supporting EDNS(0) must return FORMERR (RFC 6891, section 7):

Responders that choose not to implement the protocol extensions defined in this document MUST respond with a return code (RCODE) of FORMERR to messages containing an OPT record in the additional section and MUST NOT include an OPT record in the response.

Servers supporting EDNS(0) must reply with EDNS(0) (RFC 6891, section 6.1.1):

If an OPT record is present in a received request, compliant responders MUST include an OPT record in their respective responses.

To eliminating the risk of falsely classifying the server as not supporting EDNS due e.g. firewall issues, the UDP buffer size is set to 512 bytes (octets).

6.19.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_VERSION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_ERROR (ERROR)

6.19.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.19.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.19.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.19.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.19.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.20. dns-nameserver04 - Same source address

6.20.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.20.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver04.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Responses from the authoritative name servers must contain same source IP address as the destination IP address of the initial query. This has been clarified in section 4 of RFC 2181.

6.20.3. Errors

6.21. dns-nameserver05 - Behaviour against AAAA query

6.21.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.21.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver05.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Older implementations of authoritative name servers have shown different misbehaviours trying to answer queries for AAAA records, as described in RFC 4074. This test case is intended to find out if the name server authoritative for the domain shows any of these behaviours.

6.21.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)

6.21.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.21.5. Resources

  • None specified.

6.21.6. Dependencies

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.22. dns-nameserver06 - NS can be resolved

6.22.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.22.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver06.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

All name servers names listed for a delegation must be resolvable in DNS. If they are not resolvable using DNS this is a sign of misconfiguration, and raises the risk of unreachability for the domain. It could also lower the performance for any resolver trying to resolve the name.

The objective of this test is to resolve the domain using all the listed name servers used in the delegation. More information about resolver behavior is in section 7 of RFC 1035.

6.22.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_NAMESERVER06_FAILED (ERROR)

6.22.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.22.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.22.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.22.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.22.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.23. dns-nameserver08 - Testing QNAME case insensitivity

6.23.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.23.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver08.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The DNS standards require that nameservers treat names with case insensitivity. That is, the names example.com and EXAMPLE.COM should resolve to the same IP address. However, in the response, most nameservers echo back the name as it appeared in the request, preserving the original case.

Therefore, another way to add entropy to requests is to randomly vary the case of letters in domain names queried. This technique, also known as “0x20” because bit 0x20 is used to set the case of of US-ASCII letters, was first proposed in the IETF internet draft Use of Bit 0x20 in DNS Labels to Improve Transaction Identity. With this technique, the nameserver response must match not only the query name, but the case of every letter in the name string; for example, wWw.eXaMpLe.CoM or WwW.ExamPLe.COm. This may add little or no entropy to queries for the top-level and root domains, but it’s effective for most hostnames.

6.23.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_NAMESERVER08_FAILED (ERROR)

6.23.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.23.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.23.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.23.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.23.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.24. dns-nameserver09 - Testing QNAME case sensitivity

6.24.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.24.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver09.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

There has been cases where the nameservers respond with complete case-sensitivity (in violation of the DNS standards): that is, they match the exact case of the name in the response; but return different results for equivalent names with different cases in the request (typically NXDOMAIN).

6.24.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_NAMESERVER09_FAILED (ERROR)

6.24.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.24.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.24.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.24.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.24.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.25. dns-nameserver10 - Test for undefined EDNS version

6.25.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.25.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver10.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

EDNS (RFC 6891) is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a DNS implementation, and is required by new functionality in DNS such as DNSSEC (RFC 4033, section 3).

RFC 6891, section 6.1.3, states that if a nameserver has implemented EDNS but has not implemented the version level of the request, then it MUST respond with RCODE “BADVERS”. Only version “0” has been defined for EDNS.

Note that RCODE “BADVERS” is an extended RCODE which is calculated from the combination of the normal RCODE field in the DNS package header (RFC 1035, section 4.1.1) and the OPT record EXTENDED-RCODE field (RFC 6891, section 6.1.3). Also see IANA RCODE Registry.

6.25.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_N10_EDNS_RESPONSE_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_N10_NO_RESPONSE_EDNS1_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_N10_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)

6.25.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.25.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.25.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.25.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.25.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.26. dns-nameserver11 - Test for unknown EDNS OPTION-CODE

6.26.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.26.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver11.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

EDNS is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a DNS implementation, and is now basically required by any new functionality in DNS such as DNSSEC (RFC 6891).

RFC 6891, section 6.1.2, states that any OPTION-CODE values not understood by a responder or requestor MUST be ignored. Unknown OPTION-CODE values must be processed as though the OPTION-CODE was not even there.

In this test case, we will query with an unknown EDNS OPTION-CODE and expect that the OPTION-CODE is not present in the response for the query.

6.26.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_N11_NO_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_RETURNS_UNKNOWN_OPTION_CODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_ANSWER_SECTION (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNSET_AA (ERROR)

6.26.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.26.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.26.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.26.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.26.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.27. dns-nameserver12 - Test for unknown EDNS flags

6.27.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.27.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver12.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

EDNS is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a dns implementation, and is now basically required by any new functionality in dns such as DNSSEC (RFC 6891).

RFC 6891, section 6.1.4, states that “Z” flag bits must be set to zero by senders and ignored by receiver.

IANA lists the flags in the EDNS Header Flags assignment list.

In this test case, the query will have an unknown EDNS flag set, i.e. one of the Z flag bits set to “1”, and it is expected that all “Z” bits to be clear in the response (set to “0”).

6.27.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_Z_FLAGS_NOTCLEAR (ERROR)

6.27.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.27.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.27.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.27.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.27.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.28. dns-nameserver13 - Test for truncated response on EDNS query

6.28.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.28.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver13.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

EDNS is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a DNS implementation, and is now basically required by any new functionality in DNS such as DNSSEC (RFC 6891).

RFC 6891, section 7 states that an OPT record must be included in a truncated response, if the query includes an OPT pseudo record.

This Test Case will try to verify that if the response to a query with an OPT record is truncated, then the response will contain an OPT record.

To trigger a truncated response, the OPT pseudo record ‘DO’ bit is set and the buffer size is limited to 512 bytes. If the zone is not signed with DNSSEC, the response will probably not be truncated anyway.

6.28.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MISSING_OPT_IN_TRUNCATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_ERROR (ERROR)

6.28.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.28.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.28.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.28.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.28.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.30. dns-syntax05 - Misuse of '@' character in the SOA RNAME field

6.30.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.30.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Syntax-TP/syntax05.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The SOA RNAME field does not allow the ‘@’ characters to be used for describing a mailbox. The first dot (‘.’) is thus translated into the ‘@’ character. This is a common mistake. The rules are defined in RFC 1035.

6.30.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_SYNTAX05_FAILED (ERROR)

6.30.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.30.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.30.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.30.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.30.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.31. dns-syntax06 - No illegal characters in the SOA RNAME field

6.31.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.31.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Syntax-TP/syntax06.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The SOA RNAME field is a mailbox address. The SOA RNAME field is defined in RFC 1035, section 3.3.13 and in RFC 1912, section 2.2. The RNAME field should follow the rules of an e-mail address also defined in RFC 5322, section 3.4.1.

6.31.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_DOMAIN_INVALID (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_DOMAIN_LOCALHOST (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_ILLEGAL_CNAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_RFC822_INVALID (ERROR)

6.31.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.31.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.31.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.31.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.31.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.32. dns-syntax07 - No illegal characters in the SOA MNAME field

6.32.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.32.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Syntax-TP/syntax07.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The SOA MNAME field is a hostname. Hostnames are valid according to the rules defined in RFC 952, in section 2.1 in RFC 1123, section 11 in RFC 2182 and section 2 and 5 in RFC 3696. Newer RFCs may override some rules defined in earlier documents.

6.32.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_SYNTAX07_FAILED (ERROR)

6.32.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.32.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.32.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.32.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.32.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.33. dns-zone07 - SOA master is not an alias

6.33.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.33.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Zone-TP/zone07.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

Any NS type record should not be a CNAME. The SOA MNAME should in this respect not be a CNAME.

Quote from 2.4 in RFC 1912:

Having NS records pointing to a CNAME is bad and may conflict badly with current BIND servers.

The SOA MNAME field is described in section 3.3.13 in RFC 1035.

The RIPE-203 recommendation for the minimum value 2 days, but the negative caching is now the norm. DNSCheck has a recommended value of between 300 seconds (5 minutes) and 86400 seconds (1 day).

6.33.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_DNS_ZONE07_FAILED (ERROR)

6.33.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.33.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.33.6. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.33.7. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.33.8. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suite(s):

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.34. dns-zone10 - No multiple SOA records

6.34.1. Maturity Level

  • BETA: complete but likely to require further changes

6.34.2. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Zone-TP/zone10.md. Some of the information below may not be applicable to the RST system.

Objective

The SOA record is crucial for the DNS zone and “exactly one SOA RR should be present at the top of the zone” (RFC 1035, section 5.2). This test case will verify that the zone of the domain to be tested return exactly one SOA record.

6.34.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_SOA_IN_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_WRONG_SOA (ERROR)

6.34.4. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

6.34.5. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test case, in addition to those defined in the test suite:

  • None specified.

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.35. dns-zz-idna2008-compliance - IDNA2008 compliance check

6.35.1. Maturity Level

  • ALPHA: very rough outline, much more work needed

6.35.2. Description

In addition to the other tests case in this suite, which come from Zonemaster, this test case exists to confirm that all DNS host names which appear in resource records at the TLD apex conform to the IDNA2008 specifications.

The names that appear in the MNAME and RNAME fields of the TLD SOA record MUST be comprised solely of (a) ASCII-only labels or (b) IDN labels that conform to the requirements of IDNA2008.

6.35.3. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors, in addition to those defined in test suite:

  • DNS_IDNA2008_INVALID_MNAME (ERROR)
  • DNS_IDNA2008_INVALID_RNAME (ERROR)

  • None specified.
